statement.p: Jalen is conducting market research on the amount typically spent on the purchase of a first vehicle. Jalen has determined that the average cost of a first vehicle is 5800, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 720.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected first-time vehicle purchase is more than 4790. (Round to 4 decimal places.)
b. The cost of the middle 30 of first-time vehicle purchases falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. If a random sample of 50 first-time vehicle purchasers is selected, what is the probability that the sample average amount spent is between 5710 and 5980? (Round to 4 decimal places.)

solution.p: a. Since the probability here is for a single randomly selected consumer, we use the \displaystyle{X} distribution, which has mean and standard deviation as given.

Using Desmos (or other technology), define the distribution: \displaystyle\text{normaldist}{\left({5800},{720}\right)}. Then use the dropdown menu and select REGION: Right and COMPUTE: AREA. Enter the VALUE \displaystyle{4790} and the probability is given:

b. To find the cutoff values for the middle \displaystyle{30}\% of the distribution, define the distribution again, and then use the dropdown menu and select REGION: Inner and COMPUTE: BOUNDS. Enter the middle AREA of 0.3, and the boundaries are given: \displaystyle{5523}\leq{x}\leq{6077}.

Alternatively (older Desmos method), for the middle 30, need the remaining \displaystyle{1}-{0.3}={0.7} of the area to be split between the 2 tails. This means that the area to the left of the lower bound is 0.35, and the area to the right of the upper bound is 0.35, resulting in an area to the left of the upper bound of 0.65. In Desmos (or other technology), we find each of these values using .inversecdf with the \displaystyle{X} distribution:
c. The probability here is related to \displaystyle\overline{{X}} , so now we use the sampling disitribution of means to find the probability (NOT the underlying \displaystyle{X} distribution).

Define the distribution: \displaystyle\text{normaldist}{\left({5800},\frac{{720}}{\sqrt{{{50}}}}\right)} . Then use the dropdown menu and select REGION: Inner (for a "between" values area) and COMPUTE: Area. Enter the boundaries and the probability (area) is given: \displaystyle{P}{\left({5710}\leq{x}\leq{5980}\right)}={0.7731}
